help-file.title: GROUP
help-file.content:
Syntax: group <playername> (to add a member to your group) group me (to leave a group) group (to see who is currently in your group)
As you gain levels, you will find that a "Group" will be needed to progress further in Duris. In order to form a group, first you must find other players to group with. Once you have all gotten together in one place and are ready to go, a leader must be selected. All players must "Consent" the leader to be part of the group by typing 'consent <leadername>'. The leader can now toggle group membership for each player by typing 'group <playername>'. In addition, if all potential group members are following the group leader, he can type 'group all' to automatically group anyone following him who is not already grouped. When a person groups others, he is automatically included in the group as the group leader.
For example, Fizzwig and Oinkoink wish to form a group with Manwich.
Manwich toggles group membership by typing: group fizzwig group oinkoink
If Manwich types 'group fizzwig' after the group has been formed, Fizzwig will be kicked out of the group. If a group member, including the group leader, types 'group me', they will be removed from the group and the next player down the group list will automatically become the leader. Typing 'group' with no argument will show you a list of people in the group and their condition.
Groups are comprised of the group leader and people in front and rear ranks. Type 'group <playername> front' to send a group member to the front ranks, and type 'group <playername> rear' to send a group member to the rear ranks. Your position in the ranks determines how much damage you inflict (and receive) from spells and physical attacks.
Players that form a group still get the FULL amount of experience points when they kill a monster. This means there is no reason not to group with another player if you only look at the experience factor. Everyone gets exp regardless if they participate in the fight or not. In addition, frags are divided among grouped players.
If you find yourself in need of a group, you may implement the "Group Needed" toggle.
